output_list.description: The 'sell' function 'distribute' has an integer overflow in the line 'totalAmount += _amounts[a];', allowing an attacker to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.

output_list.reason: The 'distribute' function has an integer overflow in the line 'totalAmount += _amounts[a];', allowing an attacker to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The 'sell' function has an integer overflow in the line 'msg.sender.transfer(amount * price - transferFees);', allowing an attacker to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
The 'mintToken' function has an outdated constructor naming convention, enabling a Typo attack.
Predictable winner selection without secure randomness, enabling DoS attacks.
The 'ToOwner' function allows any user to claim ownership and funds.
The 'mintToken' function allows any user to set the balance of an arbitrary user to any value.
